api/BOOSEAppASE.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | BOOSEDocSite
api/BOOSEAppASE.AppCanvas.html.summary: Class AppCanvas Namespace BOOSEAppASE Assembly BOOSEAppASE.dll A class creating a canvas interface for BOOSE, implementing BOOSE.ICanvas. Provides a number of methods for drawing/editing including Circle(int, bool), Rect(int, int, bool), MoveTo(int, int) and DrawTo(int, int). public class AppCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object AppCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCanvas(int, int) Creates a new canvas in the form of a bitmap. A graphics object is created using this bitmap, with its initial colour set to white. Pen settings are initialised to start at the point 0,0 and with the colour set to black. public AppCanvas(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int Width of the canvas. ysize int Height of the canvas. Properties PenColour Gets and sets the current pen colour. public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object Xpos Gets and sets the current x coordinate for the pen position. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int Ypos Gets and sets the current y coordinate for the pen position. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle to the canvas around the current pen position. The size of the circle is determined by the radius. The circle can either be an outline or filled. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int Radius value of the circle, used to determine the circle's size. filled bool Boolean value to determine whether the circle is filled. Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown if the circle radius value is less than one. Clear() Clears the canvas of anything drawn onto it. Resets the background colour to white. public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current pen position to a given coordinate. The x and y values for the pen position are then updated. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x coordinate value to be drawn to. y int The y coordinate value to be drawn to. Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown when the x and/or y coordinates given are negative values. MoveTo(int, int) Updates the current pen position to a position determined by a given coordinate, without drawing. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x coordinate value to be moved to. y int The y coordinate value to be moved to. Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown when the x and/or y coordinates given are negative values. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle to the canvas, starting from the current pen position. The size is determined by the given width and height values. The rectangle can either be an outline or filled. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width value of the rectangle, used to determine the rectangle's size. height int The height value of the rectangle, used to determine the rectangle's size. filled bool Boolean value to determine whether the rectangle is filled. Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown when the width and/or height values given are less than zero. Reset() Resets the pen position to the top left corner of the canvas. Sets both x and y coordinates to 0. public void Reset() Set(int, int) Creates and sets the size values for a new canvas. Any previous graphics objects will be dropped first. The width and height will be set, along with providing a clear white canvas. The pen position will automatically be set to the top left position (0,0). public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int The given width assigned to the canvas, to determine its size. height int The given height assigned to the canvas, to determine its size. Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown when the width and/or height values are negative. SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the pen colour using three values (red, green, blue) between 0 and 255. Any following drawing commands will use this colour. public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int Red colour value (between 0 and 255). green int Green colour value (between 0 and 255). blue int Blue colour value (between 0 and 255). Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown when either the red, green or blue values given are not between 0 and 255. Tri(int, int) This will draw a triangle to the canvas. This will be implemented in part 2. public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int Width value given for the bounding rectangle that the triangle will be drawn in. height int Height value given for the bounding rectangle that the triangle will be drawn in. Exceptions NotImplementedException Method not currently implemented. WriteText(string) This will draw text onto the canvas. This will be implemented in part 2. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text to be written onto the canvas. Exceptions NotImplementedException Method not currently implemented. getBitmap() Returns the canvas bitmap so that Form1 can display the image. public object getBitmap() Returns object The canvas bitmap containing any drawings.

api/BOOSEAppASE.AppCircle.html.title: Class AppCircle | BOOSEDocSite
api/BOOSEAppASE.AppCircle.html.summary: Class AppCircle Namespace BOOSEAppASE Assembly BOOSEAppASE.dll A class to create the updated Circle command, referenced in the AppCommandFactory. The class overrides BOOSE limitations, allowing a circle of any size to be drawn on the canvas. public class AppCircle : CommandOneParameter, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter AppCircle Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks BOOSE.CommandOneParameter is extended to ensure that only one parameter can be entered (radius). Constructors AppCircle() Blank constructor to instantiate the Circle command. public AppCircle() AppCircle(Canvas, int) Constructor that passes the canvas to the base class and sets the radius value. public AppCircle(Canvas c, int radius) Parameters c Canvas The canvas for commands to be used on. radius int The radius value to set the size of the circle. Methods CheckParameters(string[]) Checks for incorrect parameters before the command is executed. Checks that only one parameter has been entered and that the radius value is an integer. If this is not the case, an exception will be thrown. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameterList) Parameters parameterList string[] The list of parameters, used here to handle exceptions. Exceptions ParserException Thrown if the number of parameters is not one or if the radius value given is not an integer. Execute() Executes the Circle command. The circle is drawn on the canvas around the pen position. Its size is set by the radius. The radius is expected to be greater than zero. public override void Execute() Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown when the radius value given is less than one.

api/BOOSEAppASE.AppCommandFactory.html.title: Class AppCommandFactory | BOOSEDocSite
api/BOOSEAppASE.AppCommandFactory.html.summary: Class AppCommandFactory Namespace BOOSEAppASE Assembly BOOSEAppASE.dll A command factory that overrides or extends the original BOOSE BOOSE.CommandFactory. Commands are created in this class to overcome limitations in the base Command Factory. public class AppCommandFactory : CommandFactory, ICommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory AppCommandFactory Implements ICommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks If the command is not available in this factory, the base factory will be used. If both of these options fail and the command is not recognisable, an error will be thrown. Methods MakeCommand(string) Creates and returns a command type to allow full access to the commands without limitations. Original BOOSE.CommandFactory is accessed if the command does not exist in this one. public override ICommand MakeCommand(string commandType) Parameters commandType string The given command type to be created. Returns ICommand An BOOSE.ICommand object of the command type. Exceptions ParserException Thrown if the command type entered is not recognised in either the AppCommandFactory or the original BOOSE.CommandFactory.

api/BOOSEAppASE.AppMoveTo.html.title: Class AppMoveTo | BOOSEDocSite
api/BOOSEAppASE.AppMoveTo.html.summary: Class AppMoveTo Namespace BOOSEAppASE Assembly BOOSEAppASE.dll A class to create the updated Moveto command, referenced in the AppCommandFactory. The class overrides BOOSE limitations, allowing the pen to be moved to any point on the canvas with x and y coordinate values. public class AppMoveTo : CommandTwoParameters, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter CommandTwoParameters AppMoveTo Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandTwoParameters.param2 CommandTwoParameters.param2unprocessed CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters is extended to ensure that only two parameters can be entered (x and y). Constructors AppMoveTo() Blank constructor to instantiate the Moveto command. public AppMoveTo() AppMoveTo(Canvas, int, int) Constructor that passes the canvas to the base class and sets the x and y values. public AppMoveTo(Canvas c, int x, int y) Parameters c Canvas The canvas for commands to be used on. x int The x coordinate value for the pen to be moved to. y int The y coordinate value for the pen to be moved to. Methods CheckParameters(string[]) Checks for incorrect parameters before the command is executed. Checks to ensure that there are exactly two parameters and that each coordinate value is an integer. Entering the wrong data type or number of parameters will throw an exception. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameterList) Parameters parameterList string[] The list of parameters, used here to handle exceptions. Exceptions ParserException Thrown when the number of parameters does not equal two or when the given x and y values are not integers. Execute() Executes the Moveto command. The pen will be moved to the position specified by the x and y coordinate values. Both x and y coordinates are expected to be positive. public override void Execute() Exceptions StoredProgramException Thrown when given x and/or y coordinate values are negative.

api/BOOSEAppASE.AppRect.html.title: Class AppRect | BOOSEDocSite
api/BOOSEAppASE.AppRect.html.summary: Class AppRect Namespace BOOSEAppASE Assembly BOOSEAppASE.dll A class to create the updated Rectangle command, referenced in the AppCommandFactory. The class overrides BOOSE limitations, allowing a rectangle of any width and height to be drawn on the canvas. public class AppRect : CommandTwoParameters, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter CommandTwoParameters AppRect Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandTwoParameters.param2 CommandTwoParameters.param2unprocessed CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters is extended to ensure that only two parameters can be entered (width and height). Constructors AppRect() Blank constructor to instantiate the Rectangle command. public AppRect() AppRect(Canvas, int, int) Constructor that passes the canvas to the base class and sets the width and height values. public AppRect(Canvas c, int width, int height) Parameters c Canvas The canvas for commands to be used on. width int The parameter to set the width value of the rectangle. height int The parameter to set the height value of the rectangle. Methods CheckParameters(string[]) Checks for incorrect parameters before the command is executed. Checks that exactly two parameters have been entered and that the height and width values are integers. If this is not the case, an exception will be thrown. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameterList) Parameters parameterList string[] The list of parameters, used here to handle exceptions. Exceptions ParserException Thrown when the number of parameters is not two and when width and/or height inputs are not integers. Execute() Executes the Rectangle command. Starting at the pen position, a rectangle will be drawn with the dimensions set by the width and height inputs. Width and height values are expected to be greater than zero. public override void Execute() Exceptions StoredProgramException Throws when inputted width and/or height values are less than one.

object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks Exception catching is handled in this form. The canvas, factory, program and parser are all declared. Constructors Form1() BOOSE library 'about' information is displayed into the debug window when the program is run. A bitmap drawing canvas is created, along with a command factory to build commands, a program to store commands and a parser to convert user input into BOOSE commands. public Form1() Methods Dispose(bool) Clean up any resources being used. protected override void Dispose(bool disposing) Parameters disposing bool true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false. RunButton_Click(object, EventArgs) Executes when the Run Button on the User Interface is clicked. The canvas will be reset and cleared before parsing and executing commands entered in the input box. Parsed commands will be drawn to the canvas. Any general or BOOSE exceptions thrown will be caught and displayed with a clear message in the error output box. public void RunButton_Click(object sender, EventArgs e) Parameters sender object The Run Button on the UI to run commands. e EventArgs Event arguments for the Run Button click action.

api/BOOSEAppASE.html.title: Namespace BOOSEAppASE | BOOSEDocSite
api/BOOSEAppASE.html.summary: Namespace BOOSEAppASE Classes AppCanvas A class creating a canvas interface for BOOSE, implementing BOOSE.ICanvas. Provides a number of methods for drawing/editing including Circle(int, bool), Rect(int, int, bool), MoveTo(int, int) and DrawTo(int, int). AppCircle A class to create the updated Circle command, referenced in the AppCommandFactory. The class overrides BOOSE limitations, allowing a circle of any size to be drawn on the canvas. AppCommandFactory A command factory that overrides or extends the original BOOSE BOOSE.CommandFactory. Commands are created in this class to overcome limitations in the base Command Factory. AppMoveTo A class to create the updated Moveto command, referenced in the AppCommandFactory. The class overrides BOOSE limitations, allowing the pen to be moved to any point on the canvas with x and y coordinate values. AppRect A class to create the updated Rectangle command, referenced in the AppCommandFactory. The class overrides BOOSE limitations, allowing a rectangle of any width and height to be drawn on the canvas. Form1 The primary User Interface for drawing with BOOSE, extending Form. Creates a physical interface with a command input box, drawing canvas box, run button and an error output box.

api/BOOSETest.BOOSEUnitTests.html.title: Class BOOSEUnitTests | BOOSEDocSite
api/BOOSETest.BOOSEUnitTests.html.summary: Class BOOSEUnitTests Namespace BOOSETest Assembly BOOSETest.dll [TestClass] public sealed class BOOSEUnitTests Inheritance object BOOSEUnitTests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods DrawTo_Pen_Position_Test() [TestMethod] public void DrawTo_Pen_Position_Test() MoveTo_Pen_Position_Test() [TestMethod] public void MoveTo_Pen_Position_Test() MultiLine_Pen_Position_Test() [TestMethod] public void MultiLine_Pen_Position_Test()
